The place is small and very noisy inside.  We came in to have Sunday brunch after we were told the place next door (Milk) had a wait. I ordered a mimosa which was good.  We asked for tap water but were told that is illegal in Barcelona (other restaurants never told us that).  I ordered the Eggs Benedict Barcelona which had pesto, mozzarella, and a tomato with Hollandaise sauce. The Hollandaise sauce didn't seem home made.  It came with potatoes which were pretty tasty. I ordered a aside of hash brown potatoes (the waitress didn't tell me my dish came with potatoes, thanks).  The hash brown was terrible! I took one bite and was grossed out.  It tasted like what I imagine a spoonful grease would taste like.  They still charged us for it even after we complained. My hubby ordered the pancakes with dulce de Leche and bananas.  They were good and filling.  He asked for a large glass of OJ but the waitress told him they don't sell OJ in large glasses. He asked if he could order 2 glasses and she was still confused. It was just a weird interaction.  I don't think I'd really recommend this place.
